this is for people like vaccine  , Our group has been using the PLUS Cardiac Test (GD Biosciences, Inc, Irvine, CA) a clinically validated measurement of multiple protein biomarkers which generates a score predicting the 5 yr risk (percentage chance) of a new Acute Coronary Syndrome (ACS). The score is based on changes from the norm of multiple protein biomarkers including IL-16, a proinflammatory cytokine, soluble Fas, an inducer of apoptosis, and Hepatocyte Growth Factor (HGF)which serves as a marker for chemotaxis of T-cells into epithelium and cardiac tissue, among other markers. Elevation above the norm increases the PULS score, while decreases below the norm lowers the PULS score.The score has been measured every 3-6 months in our patient population for 8 years. Recently, with the advent of the mRNA COVID 19 vaccines (vac) by Moderna and Pfizer, dramatic changes in the PULS score became apparent in most patients.This report summarizes those results. A total of 566 pts, aged 28 to 97, M:F ratio 1:1 seen in a preventive cardiology practice had a new PULS test drawn from 2 to 10 weeks following the 2nd COVID shot and was compared to the previous PULS score drawn 3 to 5 months previously pre- shot. Baseline IL-16 increased from 35=/-20 above the norm to 82 =/- 75 above the norm post-vac; sFas increased from 22+/- 15 above the norm to 46=/-24 above the norm post-vac; HGF increased from 42+/-12 above the norm to 86+/-31 above the norm post-vac. These changes resulted in an increase of the PULS score from 11% 5 yr ACS risk to 25% 5 yr ACS risk. At the time of this report, these changes persist for at least 2.5 months post second dose of vac.We conclude that the mRNA vacs dramatically increase inflammation on the endothelium and T cell infiltration of cardiac muscle and may account for the observations of increased thrombosis, cardiomyopathy, and other vascular events following vaccination.

When a vaccine works perfectly, as do the childhood vaccines for smallpox, polio, mumps, rubella and measles, it prevents vaccinated individuals from being sickened by the disease, and it also prevents them from transmitting the virus to others. Less-than-perfect vaccines create a “leaky” barrier against the virus. Vaccinated individuals may get sick but have less severe symptoms, but the virus survives long enough to transmit to others, which allows it to survive and spread throughout a population. Leaky vaccines can promote the evolution of nastier ‘hot’ viral strains.

So what is the carrier?  Our cells are fantastic at keeping foreign material out.  Viruses are unfortunately able to by-pass this protection.  In order to get sick by a virus the virus's genetic material, used to cause the infection, must be protected by a protein coat.  The protein coat also has the ability to by-pass the cell's defenses and injects the viral genetic material into the cell to begin viral reproduction.  The cell explodes after it gets filled will viral protein coats packaged with viral genetic material and these new viruses go on to attack other cells repeating the process.  Now If I inject you with viral genetic material of any kind only this is rapidly recognized as foreign and destroyed by your immune system.  It can't get into your cells to start reproduction, producing viruses and thus symptomatic infection because there is NO natural mechanism to do so.  So what is this "carrier" that protects the foreign genetic material AND injects it into one's cells?  This process is NOT vaccination.  The word vaccination comes from the latin name for smallpox "vaccinia".  The root of vaccinia is cow as it was discovered that humans injected with cow pox obtained immunity from smallpox and were thus "vaccinated".  By definition a vaccine is the introduction of weakened or dead organisms by injection to stimulate the immune system.  That's NOT what any m-RNA injectable does.  These injectables should therefore be termed more correctly as gene therapies NOT as vaccines.  But coming back to the carrier....  I have no doubt that it is feasible.  But what is it? UNDERSTANDING THE METHODS OF VIROLOGY:

 

In virology, what they call "isolation" of a virus, is taking a fluid sample from a sick patient and then applying that to a Cell Culture-> An adulterated mixture of tissue/cells (usually monkey kidney cells) antibiotics, fetal bovine serum, amphotericin, etc. (all substances Knowingly Toxic to cells) and supplying the cells

With only minimal nutrients in order to "grow a viral culture" where it can purportedly replicate. There, they "confirm virus isolation" and replication by monitoring the cells for cytopathic effects (destruction) with a microscope and genetic detection of the virus via RT-PCR.

That is the basic standardized method of what it means to have "isolated" a virus in Virology, which for them serves as proof.

They believe those methods are sufficient evidence because by checking for certain

genetic material (they believe is related to a virus) they are able to approximate or match the

genetic identity or homology of that material to other viruses in their database. In the case of Sars-cov-2, they said it was about an 80% genetic match to Sars-1, which is how they "know" it's a virus. And by also seeing the cells in the culture die, that all serves as "proof" that they found a virus. They then capture images of the objects they say are viruses under an electron microscope for a final confirmation.

So in virology: Finding certain genetic material + cytopathic effects + micrographs of particles in a cell culture = we found a virus.

 

WHY THEY ARE WRONG;

(1) Virologists literally NEVER run an equally treated "'non-infected" cell culture control experiment to compare against the "infected" cell culture. It's like not having a control group.

Basic & furndamental science is completely MIA in virology. A snippet from the article ‘Public should be told that vaccines may have long term adverse effects”
John Barthelow Classen, President and David C Classen, Infectious disease physician’: ( link to the article below):

Research into immunisation has been based on the theory that the benefits of immunisation far outweigh the risks from delayed adverse events and so long term safety studies do not need to be performed. When looking at diabetes—only one potential chronic adverse event—we found that the rise in the prevalence of diabetes may more than offset the expected decline in long term complications of H influenzae meningitis. Thus diabetes induced by vaccine should not be considered a rare potential adverse event. The incidence of many other chronic immunological diseases, including asthma, allergies, and immune mediated cancers, has risen rapidly and may also be linked to immunisation.

We believe that the public should be fully informed that vaccines, though effective in preventing infections, may have long term adverse effects. An educated public will probably increasingly demand proper safety studies before widespread immunisation. We believe that the outcome of this decision will be the development of safer vaccine technology.”

Article information

BMJ. 1999 Jan 16; 318(7177): 193.

1. Is this process similar to anything that naturally happens in properly functioning organisms?
That is, do cells ever share RNAs between themselves?
